titleStmt.title: Uriah McClancy et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5906

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Thos E Bramlette Govenor of Ky

Your undersigned petitioner states that at the august Term of the Rockcastle circuit court 1864 he was fined Seventy dollars & cost. for selling liquor by the smalls without being sworn as required by law. lately passed He states that at the time he sold as afsd he did not know it was required of him to be sworn and had he of known it was required he would have fulfilled the law as he never has or yet has any inclination to transgress upon the statute laws of his state or any other established law
Wherefore he humbly asks the Executive to interpose and Remit his fine except fees and cost --
Sworn to before me by Uriah McClancy Octo 24th 1864
We are of the opinion & belief that that the above fine should be remitted we believe no violation of law was intended by said McClancy --

E T. Fisk
A Smith C.R.C.C
W. A. Brooks

Rockcastle Cir Ct
vs
W McClancy
$20,
Remit
8th Nov/64
